document_name_accent: ung thu co tu cung giai doan 1.json
document_title: Cervical cancer stage I (early stage): Symptoms and treatment
subsection_content:
Dr. Vu Huu Khiem - Head of Oncology Department, Tam Anh General Hospital, Hanoi, said that symptoms of stage 1 (early stage) cervical cancer are often unclear. The disease progresses over many years, so cervical cancer screening is the best way to detect abnormalities at this stage.
Stage I cervical cancer signs and symptoms may include:
Vaginal discharge with blood and vaginal discharge;; Vaginal bleeding after intercourse, between menstrual cycles or after menopause;; Menstruation may be heavier and last longer than usual.
If not treated promptly, the disease will progress through the following stages and cause symptoms including:
Difficulty urinating, painful urination, sometimes blood in urine;; Diarrhea, pain or bleeding from the rectum;; Fatigue, weight loss;; Dull back pain or leg swelling;; Pelvic/abdominal pain.
If you have unusual vaginal bleeding or discharge or any other unexplained symptoms, you should have a complete gynecological exam including a Pap test.
The 5-year survival rate for stage I cervical cancer in the US is about 92% (according to SEER).
subsection_title: ung thu co tu cung giai doan 1.json. Signs of stage I cervical cancer
